result.execSummary:
The defendant Katrina Lily Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Katrina Lily Martin is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Katrina Lily Martin was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Katrina Lily Martin

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
AND ARRAIGNMENT 11:15 AM Defendant Katrina Lily Martin in court, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Katrina Lily Martin.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. In 21CF212, Attorney Nelsen received information, waives reading. State recites agreement that in 21CF321 defendant plead to Count 1 - 90 days jail imposed and stayed for 2 years probation. Conditions of probation include 1 day jail with credit for 1 day. For 22CF212, for Count 1 - 2 years initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision imposed and stayed for 2 years probation. Concurrent time and concurrent probation to 21CF321. Conditions of probation include serve 14 days with credit for 14 days. Counts 2 and 3 are dismissed. Defendant pleads no contest. Attorney Hansen stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. The Defendant understands all the rights he is waiving by his plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered. State to dismiss trailing citations. 

Court orders in 21CF321 for Count 1 - 90 days jail imposed and stayed for 2 years probation. Conditions of probation include 1 day jail with credit for 1 day, comply with programming as deemed necessary by the DOC and pay mandatory court costs. For 22CF212, for Count 1 - 4 years prison fashioned as 2 years initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision imposed and stayed for 2 years probation. Concurrent time and concurrent probation to 21CF321. Conditions of probation include serve 14 days jail with credit for 14 days, comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the DOC and pay mandatory court costs. Court dismisses trailing citations - 22TR1783, 22TR1884 and 22TR1885.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt:
1:28 PM Defendant Katrina Lily Martin appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Peter Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant's address confirmed.  Court recites charges against defendant and possible penalties. Defendant advised of right to consult an attorney. Defendant pleads guilty to count 3.  Attorney Reid speaks as an officer of the court; Defendant is represented by Attorney Nelsen. Court accepts the plea of not guilty.  Attorney Nelsen now appears; counsels defendant that not guilty plea for count three would be what they would enter.
State reviews criminal history 1fta on open file. request 1000cb
No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Atty Nelsen opposes cash bail, lifelong res, request high sb or nominal cash bail.
Court orders 1000cb No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
Return of property hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.
